Albus Dumbledore famously used it during the Battle of the Department of Mysteries to stop Death Eaters from escaping【507997908506929†L196-L204】.

charmwork_jinxes.name: Impediment Jinx
charmwork_jinxes.wand_movements: Sweep the wand horizontally then thrust it toward the target.
charmwork_jinxes.effect: This jinx slows, freezes or pushes back a target, hindering movement or momentum【827264490198892†L218-L225】. Its effect lasts only briefly and may be ineffective against certain magical creatures【827264490198892†L210-L215】.
charmwork_jinxes.notes: Miranda Goshawk described Impedimenta as vital for any duellist’s arsenal【827264490198892†L210-L215】. Defence classes practise this jinx to teach students how to stop attackers without causing harm.

charmwork_jinxes.name: Jelly‑Legs Curse
charmwork_jinxes.wand_movements: Trace a zigzag toward the target then flick down.
charmwork_jinxes.effect: This jinx causes the victim’s legs to wobble uncontrollably, collapsing as though turned to jelly【145270691583288†L449-L476】. The condition wears off on its own or can be removed with a counter‑spell.
charmwork_jinxes.notes: Listed in *Curses and Counter‑Curses*, the Jelly‑Legs Curse is a favourite prank among students. Combining it with other spells can lead to unexpected side effects, so caution is advised【145270691583288†L449-L476】.

charmwork_jinxes.name: Knockback Jinx
charmwork_jinxes.wand_movements: Jab the wand forward sharply toward the target.
charmwork_jinxes.effect: This jinx delivers a burst of force that knocks the target backward, allowing the caster to push objects or unbalance opponents【989614374539029†L441-L472】. It does not cause lasting injury but may stun or disorient the target briefly.
charmwork_jinxes.notes: Professors Flitwick and Quirrell taught Flipendo to early‑year students as a safe way to practise duelling【989614374539029†L441-L472】. Nineteenth‑century students used it to clear obstacles and fend off minor creatures【989614374539029†L491-L505】.

charmwork_jinxes.name: Silencing Charm
charmwork_jinxes.wand_movements: Flick the wand downward as if closing a zipper.
charmwork_jinxes.effect: This jinx renders the target mute and prevents them from making any sound【860019608224331†L440-L471】. Miscasting can cause swelling or an explosive noise and may temporarily deafen bystanders【860019608224331†L440-L471】.
charmwork_jinxes.notes: Magical birds such as Fwoopers are legally required to have silencing charms recast monthly to prevent their song driving people mad【860019608224331†L487-L495】. Professor Flitwick teaches the spell to fifth‑year students preparing for their O.W.L.s【860019608224331†L487-L495】.

sources.ref: The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 5

charmwork_jinxes.name: Tickling Charm
charmwork_jinxes.wand_movements: Wave the wand in a wide arc then jab forward.
charmwork_jinxes.effect: This jinx causes the target to experience intense tickling, leading to uncontrollable laughter and weakness【603023694422158†L445-L503】. The sensation is temporary and harmless but can distract an opponent during a duel【603023694422158†L495-L530】.
charmwork_jinxes.notes: The Tickling Charm appears in *The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 2* and is commonly taught to second‑year students【603023694422158†L445-L503】. It is considered a diversionary tactic rather than an offensive spell.

sources.ref: The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 2

charmwork_hexes.name: Leg‑Locker Curse
charmwork_hexes.wand_movements: Move the wand in a low arc then jab downward.
charmwork_hexes.effect: This hex glues the victim’s legs together, forcing them to hop or fall and preventing locomotion【364930248213663†L195-L206】. It does not cause lasting harm and can be ended with Finite or another counter‑spell【364930248213663†L227-L233】.
charmwork_hexes.notes: The Leg‑Locker Curse is a popular schoolyard spell, though first‑years seldom manage it successfully【364930248213663†L227-L233】. It belongs to the same family as other Locomotor spells but specifically targets mobility.

charmwork_hexes.name: Severing Charm
charmwork_hexes.wand_movements: Slice the wand in a swift, downward motion along the object to be cut.
charmwork_hexes.effect: The Severing Charm cuts and divides objects with surgical precision without tearing or burning【378163017971520†L446-L479】. When directed at living beings it can inflict serious wounds, so it should only be used on inanimate materials or under supervision.
charmwork_hexes.notes: Seamstress Delfina Crimp invented this charm in the fifteenth century to cut fabric efficiently and it appears in both the Book of Spells and The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 1【378163017971520†L508-L517】. Wizards are reminded to practise carefully and never aim the charm at themselves or others.

sources.ref: The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 1

charmwork_hexes.name: Stinging Hex
charmwork_hexes.wand_movements: Snap the wand downward to emit a burst of white light【766093943888784†L465-L521】.
charmwork_hexes.effect: This hex produces a stinging sensation on the victim’s skin, causing welts and swelling【766093943888784†L465-L521】. The pain is temporary but can incapacitate a target momentarily.
charmwork_hexes.notes: While considered dark magic, the Stinging Hex is not unforgivable and is occasionally used in duels. Overuse may leave lingering marks or mild burns on the skin.

charmwork_curses.name: Babbling Curse
charmwork_curses.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
charmwork_curses.effect: The Babbling Curse is presumed to cause a person to babble whenever they try to speak. The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
charmwork_curses.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

charmwork_curses.name: Blasting Curse
charmwork_curses.wand_movements: Point the wand directly at the target and snap the wrist to unleash an explosion.
charmwork_curses.effect: This curse causes its target to explode violently, sending shrapnel and flames that can injure or kill【718940632316438†L471-L478】. The blast can destroy buildings and is difficult to control【718940632316438†L501-L512】.
charmwork_curses.notes: Dating back at least to 1430 when Alberta Toothill used it in a duelling competition, the Blasting Curse is notoriously dangerous【718940632316438†L471-L478】. Unauthorised use is illegal, and misfires can harm the caster and allies【718940632316438†L501-L512】.

charmwork_curses.name: Bombardment Spell
charmwork_curses.wand_movements: Point the wand at the target and jab forward forcefully.
charmwork_curses.effect: The Bombardment Spell creates a loud, concentrated explosion that blasts apart doors, bars or obstacles【76804995294308†L460-L473】. Although the blast is smaller than a blasting curse, it can injure bystanders and is not suitable for stealth work.
charmwork_curses.notes: Professor Flitwick sometimes teaches Bombarda to older students for emergencies but warns that casting it indoors may bring down ceilings【76804995294308†L492-L503】. A stronger version, Bombarda Maxima, is considered too dangerous for student use.

charmwork_curses.name: Full Body‑Bind Curse
charmwork_curses.wand_movements: Slash the wand downwards as if drawing a cross over the target.
charmwork_curses.effect: This curse temporarily petrifies the target, causing their limbs to snap together and leaving them rigid and unable to move【573101217873319†L176-L208】. The victim remains conscious and can move their eyes but cannot speak until the spell wears off or is removed【573101217873319†L204-L208】.
charmwork_curses.notes: Often used in duels or to restrain creatures, the Full Body‑Bind Curse immobilises without inflicting permanent harm. Casters should release their target promptly to avoid discomfort or injury.

charmwork_curses.name: Reductor Curse
charmwork_curses.wand_movements: Point the wand at the target and thrust forcefully.
charmwork_curses.effect: This curse blasts solid objects apart, reducing them to pieces or dust【807207799215705†L448-L481】. It is dangerous in confined spaces and should never be aimed at living beings.
charmwork_curses.notes: The Reductor Curse is taught with caution because misdirected blasts can collapse ceilings or injure bystanders【807207799215705†L448-L481】. Skilled witches and wizards use it for clearing debris or excavating, but accidents are common.

counter_spells.name: Boggart-Banishing Charm
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: A spell used when fighting a Boggart, "Riddikulus" forces the Boggart to take the appearance of an object upon which the caster is concentrating. When used correctly, this will be a humorous form.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Clear-Mind Counter Charm
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Removes minor mental incapacitations, such as the Babbling Jinx or the Confundus Charm. Specially trained wizards (such as Healers or some Aurors and Unspeakables) can use it to counter the Imperius Curse, though this usually requires Legilimency therapy, especially if badly performed or long-lasting.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Constriction Curse Counter
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Relieves the effects of the Constriction Curse. Other spells and potions can do this also, but the counter-curse is the fastest and easiest method.:Also, when cast on the victim, relieves the effect of the Strangulation Hex without attacking the caster (and thus forcing him to change the aim of his wand).
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Ear Curse Counter
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Relieves the effects of spells that affect hearing for the majority of curses. Stabilizes hearing to natural levels without enhancing already impaired hearing due to physical injury or age.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Enchantment Counter-Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Spell removes enchantments on people. The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Eradication Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: The Eradication Spell (Deletrius) is a charm that can disintegrate certain objects and served as the counter-charm to the Reverse Spell, vanishing the shadow emitted from the wand. The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Eye Curse Counter
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Relieves the effects of spells that affect sight for the majority of curses. Stabilizes sight to natural levels without enhancing already impaired sight due to physical injury or age.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Finger Jinx Counter
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Releases fused fingers due to the finger jinx The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: General Counter‑Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Swish the wand lightly then focus on ending ongoing magic.
counter_spells.effect: This counter‑spell terminates minor jinxes, hexes and ongoing spell effects within its area of effect【848070089093900†L449-L484】. It may only temporarily suppress powerful enchantments and does not undo permanent transformations.
counter_spells.notes: Students learn both the short form ‘Finite’ and the more formal ‘Finite Incantatem’ in second and third‑year Charms classes【848070089093900†L449-L484】. Successful use requires awareness of active magic nearby to target the spell effectively.

sources.ref: The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 2

counter_spells.name: Head Shrink Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: The Head Shrink Spell (Redactum Skullus) is a dark charm that can be used to shrink the skull and surrounding tissue of the head of the victim. It was the counter-curse to Engorgio Skullus.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Lights Off
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Counter charm to the Lumos spell. The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Minor Healing Charm
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Reparifors is the incantation of a healing charm that reverts minor magically-induced ailments, such as paralysis and poisoning. The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Release Body Levitation
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: The counter spell to Levicorpus. Created by Severus Snape.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Reparifarge
counter_spells.wand_movements: Wave the wand over the target while focusing on its original form and pronounce the incantation clearly.
counter_spells.effect: This untransfiguration spell reverses the effects of a poorly cast transformation, restoring the target to its natural state. It is particularly useful for correcting incomplete or botched Transfiguration spells such as partially transformed animals or objects.
counter_spells.notes: A Beginner's Guide to Transfiguration stresses that attempting Reparifarge is a responsibility whenever mis‑transfigurations occur. Failure to correct a botched transformation can be dangerous, so students are encouraged to practise until they can reliably restore subjects.

counter_spells.name: Revealing Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: The Revelio Charm (Revelio) is a charm used to reveal concealed objects, messages, invisible things, and passages. It is considered difficult for a second year student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, so is probably taught in the third year.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Revert Charm
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Reverte is the incantation of a charm that can return or revert objects to their original positions or states, which might cause the targeted objects to move in reverse. The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Reviving Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Brings someone out of unconsciousness. This can be used to counteract a single Stunning Spell, although it is ineffective against multiple Stunners hitting an individual.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Shield Charm
counter_spells.wand_movements: Sweep the wand upward in a vertical arc to conjure a shield【280556299004502†L506-L512】.
counter_spells.effect: This charm creates an invisible magical barrier that reflects jinxes and physical forces back at the attacker【280556299004502†L506-L512】. The strength of the shield depends on the caster and cannot block the Killing Curse.
counter_spells.notes: In 1484 Hannah Cockleford famously used the Shield Charm to protect a boy at a jousting tournament, knocking back the charging earl【280556299004502†L448-L476】. Advanced practitioners can shape the barrier to cover themselves or others, but a powerful cast may knock opponents off their feet【280556299004502†L524-L547】.

sources.ref: The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 5

counter_spells.name: Specialis Revelio
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Causes an object to show its hidden secrets or magical properties. The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Spider Repelling Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Arania Exumai was a charm used to blast away Acromantulas or other large spiders. If the spell missed and struck a stone, it would produce a large black scorch mark, and thus was not recommended for use on humans, although casting through or along a human-produced no ill effect so long as a spider was struck.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: The Clotting Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Most basic version of the spell is used for small flesh wounds. If the wound is internal, the specific organ must be mentioned.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Wand‑Extinguishing Charm
counter_spells.wand_movements: Flick the wand downward gently to snuff the light【498797615130533†L444-L477】.
counter_spells.effect: This counter‑spell extinguishes the light produced by the Wand‑Lighting Charm, causing the wand tip to go dark【498797615130533†L444-L477】. It has no effect if there is no active lumos spell【498797615130533†L490-L495】.
counter_spells.notes: Invented as a companion to Lumos, Nox allows witches and wizards to control illumination with ease【498797615130533†L490-L495】. Students learn it immediately after mastering the Wand‑Lighting Charm.

sources.ref: The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 1

counter_spells.name: Weather-Modifying Counter-Charm
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Causes weather effects caused by incantations to cease. Will end Weather-Modifying Charms such as the Atmospheric Charm.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Wiping Spell
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Siphons material from a surface, (e.g., blood, ink, dust, etc.) The spell has limitations and should be used with care.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

counter_spells.name: Wound Healing Charm
counter_spells.wand_movements: Perform a precise wand movement consistent with the intent of the spell.
counter_spells.effect: Vulnera Sanentur is the song-like incantation of a healing spell which is used to heal deep wounds, and which can also be used as the counter-curse for the curse Sectumsempra.For maximum effect of the spell, the incantation had to be repeated thrice; firstly slowing the flow of blood to prevent death by exsanguination; the second to clear residue and begin to heal the wounds; and the third to fully knit the wounds, although dittany had to be applied to prevent scarring. Body parts that had been completely removed with Sectumsempra could not be restored even using this spell.
counter_spells.notes: This spell is part of wizarding lore predating 1890 or has unknown origins. It should be practised under supervision, as misuse can lead to unintended effects.

healing_spells.name: Anapneo
healing_spells.wand_movements: Trace a short downward line toward the target’s throat.
healing_spells.effect: This spell clears the target’s airway by vanishing whatever is obstructing it, allowing them to breathe normally again【394057784861839†L444-L472】. It does not cure underlying conditions and should be followed by further treatment.
healing_spells.notes: Anapneo is particularly useful in emergencies when someone is choking or has inhaled potions incorrectly. Professor Flitwick emphasised calm and precision when teaching the spell to students in the late nineteenth century【394057784861839†L444-L472】.

healing_spells.name: Bandaging Charm
healing_spells.wand_movements: Tap the injured limb to conjure bandages and splints【907474803019251†L447-L476】.
healing_spells.effect: This charm conjures bandages and wooden splints that wrap around a wound or limb to immobilise and support broken bones【907474803019251†L447-L476】. It alleviates pain but does not heal the underlying injury.
healing_spells.notes: Often used as first aid in the field, the Bandaging Charm provides comfort until proper medical attention can be sought. The conjured splints vanish after a period, so long‑term treatment is still necessary.

healing_spells.name: Episkey
healing_spells.wand_movements: Tap the injured area gently with the wand.
healing_spells.effect: This healing charm mends minor injuries such as broken noses, cracked bones or split lips, creating a brief hot then cold sensation【700761254867669†L459-L471】. It cannot heal serious wounds and may cause discomfort if misused【700761254867669†L483-L492】.
healing_spells.notes: Healers and mediwitches commonly use Episkey as a quick remedy, and it can also counteract the Full Body‑Bind Curse【700761254867669†L483-L492】. Overuse may leave a tingling feeling but causes no lasting harm.

dueling_spells.name: Ascension Charm
dueling_spells.wand_movements: Flick the wand sharply upward as though casting a fishing line.
dueling_spells.effect: This charm propels the caster or target straight up into the air, allowing them to ascend rapidly from the ground or underwater. The spell loses momentum after a short distance and is not suitable for sustained flight.
dueling_spells.notes: Seventh‑year students sometimes learn Ascendio to escape pits or reach high places quickly during duels. Overuse can cause dizziness and lacks the control of broom flight.

dueling_spells.name: Binding Spell
dueling_spells.wand_movements: Whip the wand in a looping motion and snap toward the target.
dueling_spells.effect: This spell conjures thick ropes out of thin air that spring forward and wrap tightly around a target, binding their limbs and restricting movement. The ropes hold until cut or dispelled and can be used to restrain creatures or opponents safely.
dueling_spells.notes: According to magical reference works, the incantation sends ropes out of thin air to bind someone【554583778224400†L96-L101】. It is a staple of defensive duelling and law‑enforcement work, but care should be taken not to cause injury when tightening the ropes.

dueling_spells.name: Boggart‑Banishing Spell
dueling_spells.wand_movements: Raise the wand, visualize a humorous transformation and flick it sharply while saying the incantation.
dueling_spells.effect: The Boggart‑Banishing Spell forces a shape‑shifting boggart to assume a comical form that the caster finds amusing. Laughter at the transformed creature strips it of power and causes it to vanish or flee.
dueling_spells.notes: Description of the spell explains that the caster must turn the boggart into something funny; the incantation ‘Riddikulus’ is intended to make the creature assume a less threatening form【396983728331597†L469-L474】. Although the spell does not destroy boggarts, it banishes them, and it is taught in third‑year Defence Against the Dark Arts classes.

dueling_spells.name: Disarming Charm
dueling_spells.wand_movements: Swish the wand upward then flick toward the opponent.
dueling_spells.effect: This charm forces whatever an opponent is holding to fly out of their hand, usually disarming them【256925718398615†L444-L478】. A powerful cast can also knock the opponent backward or send multiple weapons flying【256925718398615†L507-L516】.
dueling_spells.notes: Historians argue whether Merlin or Elizabeth Smudgling created the Disarming Charm, but its origins are lost to time【256925718398615†L444-L478】. It is a staple of non‑lethal duelling and defence training【256925718398615†L507-L516】.

sources.ref: The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 3

dueling_spells.name: Patronus Charm
dueling_spells.wand_movements: Sweep the wand in a wide arc while focusing on a happy memory, then thrust it forward with conviction.
dueling_spells.effect: This advanced charm conjures a silvery guardian known as a Patronus that shields the caster from Dementors or Lethifolds【647866904501553†L64-L69】. The form and strength of the Patronus depend on the caster’s happiest memory and magical ability【647866904501553†L64-L75】.
dueling_spells.notes: To cast the Patronus Charm one must think of a powerful happy memory while uttering the incantation. Because of its difficulty it is usually taught only to advanced students and aurors, and corporeal Patronuses can also serve as messengers in emergencies.

dueling_spells.name: Stunning Spell
dueling_spells.wand_movements: Flick the wand forward quickly while enunciating the incantation.
dueling_spells.effect: This spell produces a beam of red light that knocks the target unconscious or otherwise incapacitates them【181195725617684†L444-L485】. Multiple stunning spells can combine to increase force, and misuse may cause injury【181195725617684†L461-L474】.
dueling_spells.notes: The Stunning Spell is a standard duelling move taught to advanced Defence Against the Dark Arts students. It can halt moving objects and has a reviving counter‑charm, making it a humane way to end confrontations【181195725617684†L444-L485】.

forbidden_spells.name: Cruciatus Curse
forbidden_spells.wand_movements: Point the wand at the target and channel the desire to inflict pain.
forbidden_spells.effect: This curse inflicts excruciating, all‑consuming pain on the victim, which can lead to insanity if sustained【410711670405434†L443-L476】. The pain stops only when the caster releases the curse and leaves no physical marks.
forbidden_spells.notes: The Cruciatus Curse was declared Unforgivable in 1717 and its use brings a life sentence【410711670405434†L670-L686】. Successful casting requires a genuine desire to cause agony, and survivors often suffer psychological trauma.

forbidden_spells.name: Imperius Curse
forbidden_spells.wand_movements: Make a gentle wave over the target while focusing your will upon them.
forbidden_spells.effect: This curse enslaves the victim’s mind, placing them in a euphoric, suggestible state in which they follow the caster’s commands【932865737847561†L443-L474】. Strong‑willed individuals may resist or break free with effort.
forbidden_spells.notes: The Imperius Curse was made Unforgivable in 1717 and its use carries a life sentence【932865737847561†L629-L644】. Because victims appear to act of their own free will, the curse is insidious and difficult to detect.

forbidden_spells.name: Killing Curse
forbidden_spells.wand_movements: Aim the wand directly at the target with murderous intent.
forbidden_spells.effect: This curse causes instant, painless death accompanied by a flash of green light, leaving no physical injuries【152968516885†L455-L487】. It cannot be blocked by shields and can only be thwarted by sacrificial protection or powerful magical intervention.
forbidden_spells.notes: Classified as one of the Unforgivable Curses in 1717, the Killing Curse carries a life sentence for its use【152968516885†L846-L862】. Only a witch or wizard with a genuine desire to kill can cast it successfully.

player_created_spells.name: Bookbinding Charm
player_created_spells.wand_movements: Tap the spine of the book and draw a line along its edge.
player_created_spells.effect: This charm binds loose pages into a neat volume or repairs the spine of a damaged book, magically stitching pages together. It cannot restore missing or burned pages and is ineffective on magical tomes protected by enchantments.
player_created_spells.notes: Known for her love of literature, Ravenclaw Marcella Hemmingway created this charm to keep her textbooks intact. The Bookbinding Charm is favoured by studious Ravenclaws and librarians for preserving notes and essays.

player_created_spells.name: Skywrite Charm
player_created_spells.wand_movements: Trace the desired letters in the air, finishing each word with a flourish.
player_created_spells.effect: This charm allows the caster to write glowing words or symbols in the air or high above, where they remain visible for several minutes. It cannot create complex images and fades in strong sunlight or rain.
player_created_spells.notes: Marcella Hemmingway devised this charm in 1889 to send messages to friends across the Hogwarts grounds without risking parchment. The charm is popular among creative Ravenclaws for displaying riddles or house mottos in the sky.
